availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Moses R. Hawkins (Rowan County, Kentucky, blacksmith)

body.p: Rowan County, Kentucky, blacksmith. Virginia native. Married to Melvina Hawkins. Father of James R. Hawkins and William H. Hawkins. Married to Martha J. Nickell Hawkins in Fleming County, Kentucky, on November 12, 1843. Father of Martha E. Hawkins, Mary Jane Hawkins, John H. Hawkins, Georgiana Hawkins, and Mahala Hawkins. Blacksmith in Fleming County, Kentucky, in 1850. Blacksmith in Rowan County, Kentucky, in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, Division 2, p. 361A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Rowan County, Morehead, p. 641.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, Hillsboro, p. 431B
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Fleming County Marriages, Film #005552779, p. 107.
"Melvina Hawkins (1815-1843)," Find A Grave, Memorial #25975191, accessed January 31, 2022, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/25975191.
"Moses R. Hawkins (1812-1874)," Find A Grave, Memorial #24866080, accessed January 31, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/24866080.
